contextId.occurrenceNote: People would show their king that they were loyal to him by kissing him, perhaps on the feet. Alternate translation: "Show the son that you are truly loyal to him" or "Bow down humbly before his son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Kiss the son

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was a way of insulting people. David speaks as if Yahweh would come and physically hit his enemies. Alternate translation: "For you will insult all my enemies like someone hitting them on the jaw" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: For you will hit all my enemies on the jaw

contextId.occurrenceNote: People snort at their enemies when they think that their enemies are weak and worthless. Alternate translation: "he thinks that all his enemies are weak and worthless" or "he sneers at all his enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: he snorts at all his enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: "we will raise victory flags." They would do this to show that they were praising God because he gave their king victory over his enemies. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: we will raise banners

contextId.occurrenceNote: To place a crown on a person's head is a symbol of making him a king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: you placed on his head a crown of purest gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This describes an action used to mock someone. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: they shake their heads at me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a sign of giving honor and respect to someone. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: will bow down before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This seems to refer to a ritual washing of hands in water to symbolize freedom from sin and guilt. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I wash my hands in innocence

contextId.occurrenceNote: Lifting up hands is a symbol of worship. The writer is not worshiping the holy place, but Yahweh who lives in the holy place. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I lift up my hands toward your most holy place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was a symbol of prayer. "with my head bent down in prayer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with my head bowed on my chest

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was a symbol of pain and suffering. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I bent down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a sign of anger and hate. "they made grinding noises with their teeth at me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: they grind their teeth at me in rage

contextId.occurrenceNote: Spreading out the hands is a gesture that people used to worship and pray to a god. Alternate translation: "worshiped a strange god" or "prayed to a strange god" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: spread out our hands to a strange god

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a symbolic action that represents worship to God. Alternate translation: "lift up her hands to praise God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: reach out with her hands to God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The fact that the writer was fasting indicates that he was sad about the way people treated God's temple. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I wept and did not eat food

contextId.occurrenceNote: Wearing rough, cheap clothing was a symbol of mourning over sin. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I made sackcloth my clothing

contextId.occurrenceNote: "I lift up my hands to you." This is an action that shows that he totally depends on God. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I spread out my hands to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: To raise the right hand high into the air is a gesture that indicates power. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: right hand is high

contextId.occurrenceNote: To place a crown on a person's head is a sign of making him king. Alternate translation: "I have made a mighty man king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I have set a crown on a mighty one

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to pour oil on someone's head is a sign that God is appointing the person to be king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with my holy oil have I anointed him

contextId.occurrenceNote: To push down into the ground or dust is a sign of great humiliation. Alternate translation: "You have defiled his crown on the ground" or "You have caused his crown to fall into the dirt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: You have desecrated his crown on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: put both knees on the ground, often to show submission (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: kneel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The grinding of teeth is an expression of extreme anger. See how you translated a similar phrase in [Psalms 35:16](../035/016.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: he will grind his teeth in rage

contextId.occurrenceNote: Sitting in dirt and ashes represents either poverty or despair. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: out of the dirt ... from the ash heap

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here, to raise one's hand is a gesture of victory. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has exalted his right hand" or "Yahweh has raised his right hand in victory" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The right hand of Yahweh is exalted

contextId.occurrenceNote: To turn towards someone means to pay attention to that person. Alternate translation: "Pay attention to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Turn to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is how people prayed or praised God. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Lift up your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: Bowing down is a symbolic action that represents worship and giving honor. Alternate translation: "I will worship you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: I will bow down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a sign of being arrogant. Alternate translation: "are arrogant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: raise their heads

contextId.occurrenceNote: This action is a sign of distress or mourning. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: who are bowed down
